info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 7:02AM EDT until April 7 at 7:28PM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers...
Hocking River at Enterprise.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Hocking River at Enterprise.
* WHEN...From this morning to Monday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, The river comes out of its banks and begins to cover the flood plain area mainly near Rockbridge, with low areas near Enterprise also affected. At 17.0 feet, Flooding continues in the Village of Rockbridge, especially between east of Jackson Street, with water surrounding homes and buildings on Mill and Main Streets. Several roads both upstream and downstream of Logan become flooded, especially along Chieftain Drive. Flooding will also affect low areas along Haydenville Road near Enterprise and State Route 93 near Logan and Voris Road in Enterprise. Kachelmacher and Mingo Parks in Logan are flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this morning to 12.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon to 9.3 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will rise above flood stage again early Sunday morning to 16.8 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage again early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/iln.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO MONDAY EVENING
